intro: Comandra umbellata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf comandra, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are small, white to greenish-yellow, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating respiratory and digestive ailments.
